data.title: Conan Doyle on screen
data.text:
We have the chance to have Sir Arthur Conan Doyle himself in several silent and speaking movies. His works has been adapted on screen since his life time, and the total of adaptations is logically proportional to his huge amount of literary works. Most are Sherlock Holmes adaptations but some non-Sherlock Holmes stories like The Lost World or Rodney Stone have also been adapted since 1913.

A Life in Movies

On 19 november 2016, BFI has published a 16-minute silent movie from the Richard Lancelyn Green collection including 25 video clips showing Arthur Conan Doyle's life with family and friends in the 1920s. Here is the detailed list of the clips:

Conan Doyle Home Movie Footage 01

(26 sec.)

Conan Doyle secretary Alfred H. Wood with chauffeur

Conan Doyle Home Movie Footage 02

(32 sec.)

Arthur Conan Doyle and his dog

Conan Doyle Home Movie Footage 03+11

(76 sec.)

Arthur Conan Doyle with his daughter Mary, Mr. R. G. Monier-Williams and Miss De Morgan in front of The Psychic Bookshop

Conan Doyle Home Movie Footage 04

(41 sec.)

Arthur Conan Doyle with his wife and dog in Windlesham garden

Conan Doyle Home Movie Footage 05

(13 sec.)

Denis Conan Doyle with friend

Conan Doyle Home Movie Footage 06

(19 sec.)

Arthur Conan Doyle's parrot

Conan Doyle Home Movie Footage 07

(21 sec.)

Arthur Conan Doyle and his son Denis playing golf and walking in Windlesham garden

Conan Doyle Home Movie Footage 08

(22 sec.)

Arthur Conan Doyle and his son Denis walking in Bignell Wood garden

Conan Doyle Home Movie Footage 09

(9 sec.)

Arthur Conan Doyle

Conan Doyle Home Movie Footage 10

(140 sec.)

Arthur Conan Doyle and family in East Africa (1929)

Conan Doyle Home Movie Footage 12

(26 sec.)

Sir John Barleycorn tavern in Cadnam, Hampshire

Conan Doyle Home Movie Footage 13

(70 sec.)

Arthur Conan Doyle with family, relatives and dog at Bignell Wood (1925~1930)

Conan Doyle Home Movie Footage 14

(46 sec.)

R.M.S. Aquitania (1937)

Conan Doyle Home Movie Footage 15

(60 sec.)

Conan Doyle Home Movie Footage 16

(36 sec.)

Clement John De Garis arrives at Brisbane after his record flight from Sydney (1921)

Conan Doyle Home Movie Footage 17

(77 sec.)

Arthur Conan Doyle and Clement John De Garis applying for bonds in the Queensland Government Bond (1921)

Conan Doyle Home Movie Footage 18

(49 sec.)

East Africa

Conan Doyle Home Movie Footage 19

(22 sec.)

Garden and ducks

Conan Doyle Home Movie Footage 20

(48 sec.)

Arthur Conan Doyle playing golf with his son Adrian

Conan Doyle Home Movie Footage 21

(12 sec.)

Family in car

Conan Doyle Home Movie Footage 22

(38 sec.)

Arthur Conan Doyle playing golf and sitting with friends

Conan Doyle Home Movie Footage 23

(20 sec.)

Ball training

Conan Doyle Home Movie Footage 24

(6 sec.)

Jean Conan Doyle and gardener (?)

Conan Doyle Home Movie Footage 25

(73 sec.)

Lena Jean Conan Doyle at sporting games

Arthur, Adrian and Denis Conan Doyle (1929-1930)

Adrian in a car race, and Denis and Arthur Conan Doyle in a car with a dog.

Arthur Conan Doyle Newsreels

The Chevrons Club (for POs and NCOs) (Topical Budget 338-1) (1918)

Newsreel showing Arthur Conan Doyle arriving for the opening ceremony

Sir Arthur Conan Doyle and Family on RMS Adriatic (1922)

Newsreel showing Conan Doyle family arriving in New York

Sir Arthur Conan Doyle (1928)

Conan Doyle speech about Sherlock Holmes and spiritualism

Sir Arthur Conan Doyle arrival in Stockholm (27 october 1929)

Newsreel showing Arthur Conan Doyle with his wife Jean and his friends Mr. & Mrs. Ashton Johnson

Complete list of released movies with Arthur Conan Doyle

1929 : Sir Arthur Conan Doyle arrival in Stockholm : Conan Doyle with his wife Jean and his friends Mr. & Mrs. Ashton Johnson.

1928 : Sir Arthur Conan Doyle : Conan Doyle speech about Sherlock Holmes and spiritualism.

1926 : Sir A. Conan Doyle (Topical Budget 792-2) : Newsreel showing Conan Doyle laying foundation stone of spiritualistic church.

1925 : The Lost World : Conan Doyle introduction of the movie (lost)

1923 : Conan Doyle and family : Newsreel of Conan Doyle and family arriving in New York in 1923

1923 : Is Conan Doyle Right? : Movie exposing how fake spiritualists work.

1922 : Sir Arthur Conan Doyle and Family on RMS Adriatic : Newsreel showing Conan Doyle family arriving in New York.

1918 : The Chevrons Club (for POs and NCOs) (Topical Budget 338-1) : Newsreel showing arriving Conan Doyle at the Club

1914 : The $5,000,000 Counterfeiting Plot : Conan Doyle appeared in final scene in posed picture with William J. Burns.

1914 : Our Mutual Girl : Conan Doyle appeared as cameo in reel 22-23.

1914 : Universal Animated Weekly No. 117 : Conan Doyle was filmed in this newsreel as he arrived by ship to USA.

See also Conan Doyle Speaking (1930 audio record)

Lady Jean Conan Doyle

21.01.1931 : Lady Conan Doyle attends dramatic demonstration by Mrs. Meurig Morris (Movietone)

Richard Doyle

2014 : Interview of Richard Doyle about his Great Uncle (Arthur Conan Doyle)

Sherlock Holmes stories

Sherlock Holmes is the character who has been the most adapted on screen and especially on cinema, and from the beginning of its invention. More than 160 cinema movies have been referenced. It's more than Dracula, Frankenstein, Napoleon or Jesus Christ. All these movies are not faithfull to the original Conan Doyle's stories and characters. Click on the titles to see detailed informations on each movie (casting, photos, posters...).
